entities.name: rituals
entities.description: Structured activities performed to honor and remember the deceased.

entities.name: Deceased"s Family
entities.description: The family members of the deceased who were responsible for organizing and financing the funeral.

entities.name: jewelry
entities.description: Jewelry is a decorative item worn on the body.

entities.name: common people
entities.description: The common people were buried with care and respect.

entities.name: PRIESTS
entities.description: Priests were religious leaders who played a crucial role in the burial process, performing rituals and guiding the deceased on their journey to the afterlife

entities.name: INTERNAL ORGANS
entities.description: Internal organs were removed during the mummification process to prevent decay and ensure the body's preservation

entities.name: ANCIENT EGYPT
entities.description: Ancient Egypt is the civilization known for its elaborate burial practices and beliefs about the afterlife

entities.name: society
entities.description: Society refers to the community of people living in a particular country or region and having shared customs, laws, and organizations.

attributes.Cultural Practices: Ancient Egyptian burial practices were a vital part of society.

entities.name: AMULETS
entities.description: Amulets were small objects with magical properties, often included in the burial chamber to protect and guide the deceased in the afterlife

entities.name: AFTERLIFE
entities.description: The concept of existence beyond physical death, often associated with gods and spiritual journeys.

entities.name: protect the deceased's body and possessions
entities.description: Ensuring preservation and safeguarding of remains and belongings

entities.name: prayers
entities.description: Prayers are devotional recitations aimed at invoking divine assistance and guidance.

entities.name: soul
entities.description: The soul, in ancient Egyptian belief, was an essential part of a person that needed to be reunited with the body in the afterlife for continued existence.

attributes.Purpose: Reunited with the body in the afterlife

entities.name: gods
entities.description: The gods in ancient Egyptian belief are divine beings who inhabit the realm of the afterlife and play a crucial role in the spiritual journey of the deceased.

entities.name: tools
entities.description: Practical items used for daily tasks

entities.name: elite
entities.description: The elite refers to the upper class or ruling阶层in ancient Egyptian society, known for their wealth, power, and status.

entities.name: ordinary Egyptians
entities.description: Ordinary Egyptian people

entities.name: Skilled Individuals
entities.description: Individuals with specialized skills in various crafts and arts.

entities.name: clothing
entities.description: Wearable items for covering the body

entities.name: spells
entities.description: Formulas of power used to influence supernatural entities or events.

entities.name: gateway to the afterlife
entities.description: A symbolic entry point into the spiritual realm.

entities.name: body
entities.description: The physical form of a person, which was preserved through mummification to ensure the soul"s return.

entities.name: Important Individuals
entities.description: Important individuals in ancient Egypt included high-ranking officials, priests, and other notable figures who played significant roles in society.

entities.name: LINEN BANDAGES
entities.description: Linen bandages were used in the mummification process to wrap the preserved body, ensuring its protection and preservation

entities.name: SALT
entities.description: Salt was used in the mummification process to dry out the body and prevent decay

entities.name: food
entities.description: Nourishment for sustenance and life support.

entities.name: reverence for the deceased
entities.description: A deep and profound respect towards those who have passed away, emphasizing their importance in society and the belief in their continued existence beyond death.

entities.name: Realm of the Gods
entities.description: The realm of the gods is a divine place in ancient Egyptian belief where the souls of the deceased could achieve eternal existence.
